greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows where T(n,k) is the number of factorizations of (n+1)! into k distinct factors.
comment: n-th row has n terms; first and last term in each row = 1.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..465 (first 30 rows)
program: D(p, n, sig)={my(v=vector(n)); for(i=1, #p, v[p[i]]++); my(r=EulerT(v)); prod(i=1, #sig, r[sig[i]])/prod(i=1, #v, i^v[i]*v[i]!)}

detail(sig)={my(m=vecsum(sig)+1,n=vecmax(sig), q=Vec(exp(intformal(O(x^m) - x^n/(1-x)))/(y+x))); if(n==0, 1, (-1)^m*sum(j=0, m, my(s=0); forpart(p=j, s+=(-1)^#p*D(p, n, sig), [1, n]); s*q[#q-j]*y^m)/(1+y))}
xref: A157612 gives row sums. A157672 gives 2nd column.
results.author: _Ray Chandler_, Mar 07 2009
